normalised: So, someone asked about the best way to ensure a package arrives safely when sending it via courier in India. That is a valid concern, yaar! See, I had this situation last month, right? Had to send a saree to my cousin Priya in Bangalore, from my place at twelve, Park Street, Kolkata, seven hundred thousand and sixteen.

unnormalised: First thing, pack it REALLY well. I mean, think apocalypse level packing. Bubble wrap, good quality tape, the whole shebang. Then, when you book the courier, declare the value accurately. Don’t undervalue it to save a few Rs., because if something happens, that’s all you’ll get back. I used Blue Dart, their office is near my house at 18/A, Ballygunge Circular Road, Kolkata 700019. They were pretty good, even offered insurance for an extra ₹200.

I used Blue Dart, their office is near my house at eighteen slash A, Ballygunge Circular Road, Kolkata seven hundred thousand and nineteen. They were pretty good, even offered insurance for an extra rupee two hundred.

unnormalised: Always, always get tracking. And keep an eye on it. I was checking the status every 2 hours! Also, write the full address and phone number clearly on the package itself. Like, BIG letters. Something like "Priya Sharma, 45, 1st Main Road, Jayanagar, Bangalore, 560011. Ph: 9876543210". Better safe than sorry, right? And for very important documents or jewellery, consider using registered post; the local post office near me at GPO, Dalhousie Square, Kolkata, 700001 offers that facility, its usually much safer for high value items.
